unnormalised: ## Tuning In: How Music Streaming Revolutionized Our Entertainment
normalised: ## Tuning In: How Music Streaming Revolutionized Our Entertainment

unnormalised: Hey everyone, remember the days of painstakingly creating mixtapes and waiting for your favourite song to play on the radio? Those were the days, alright, but let's be honest, music streaming has completely transformed the entertainment landscape, hasn't it?
normalised: Hey everyone, remember the days of painstakingly creating mixtapes and waiting for your favorite song to play on the radio? Those were the days, alright, but let's be honest, music streaming has completely transformed the entertainment landscape, hasn't it?

unnormalised: From Spotify to Gaana and JioSaavn, we're absolutely spoiled for choice. I remember when my younger cousin, Priya, showed me how to make playlists on Spotify. I felt like I'd finally joined the 21st century!
normalised: From Spotify to Gaana and JioSaavn, we're absolutely spoiled for choice. I remember when my younger cousin, Priya, showed me how to make playlists on Spotify. I felt like I'd finally joined the twenty first century!

unnormalised: And the best part? Access to practically any song, any time. Want to listen to A.R. Rahman's *Dil Se* soundtrack after watching it for the 100th time? Go for it! Craving some old-school Kishore Kumar after a long day at work? Just a tap away! It's like having a massive, infinite music library right in your pocket.
normalised: And the best part? Access to practically any song, any time. Want to listen to A.R. Rahman's *Dil Se* soundtrack after watching it for the one hundredth time? Go for it! Craving some old-school Kishore Kumar after a long day at work? Just a tap away! It's like having a massive, infinite music library right in your pocket.

unnormalised: Even institutions like IIT Bombay are using music streaming for events and cultural festivals. DJs are ditching physical CDs and opting for curated playlists streamed directly to the sound system. It's way more convenient and cost-effective, I imagine.
normalised: Even institutions like I I T Bombay are using music streaming for events and cultural festivals. D J s are ditching physical C D s and opting for curated playlists streamed directly to the sound system. It's way more convenient and cost-effective, I imagine.

unnormalised: Think about it – no more rummaging through dusty cassettes or scratched CDs. No more waiting for hours to download a single song over a dial-up connection (thank goodness those days are OVER!). We can now stream high-quality audio at a fraction of the cost of buying individual albums. I'd happily pay my monthly subscription for the sheer convenience.
normalised: Think about it – no more rummaging through dusty cassettes or scratched C D s. No more waiting for hours to download a single song over a dial-up connection (thank goodness those days are OVER!). We can now stream high-quality audio at a fraction of the cost of buying individual albums. I'd happily pay my monthly subscription for the sheer convenience.

unnormalised: Of course, there are arguments about artists not being fairly compensated, and that's a valid concern. But the reality is, music streaming is here to stay. It's democratized access to music like never before.
normalised: Of course, there are arguments about artists not being fairly compensated, and that's a valid concern. But the reality is, music streaming is here to stay. It's democratized access to music like never before.

unnormalised: So, what are you listening to right now? Let me know in the comments! Maybe you'll introduce me to my next favourite artist or song! I'm always on the hunt for new tunes to add to my "Chill Vibes" playlist. Happy listening!
normalised: So, what are you listening to right now? Let me know in the comments! Maybe you'll introduce me to my next favorite artist or song! I'm always on the hunt for new tunes to add to my "Chill Vibes" playlist. Happy listening!
